10 Turner Scott

Position Guard

Height 5-10

Weight 170

Class Redshirt Senior

Hometown Clive, Iowa

High School West Des Moines Valley

Bio

Stats

Historical

Biography

Career Highs

Points: 29 vs William Jewell (12/1/2018)

Rebounds: 8 vs Quincy (12/20/2020)

Assists: 12 vs UIndy (2/4/2021)

Steals: 6 at William Jewell (2/20/2021)

Blocks: 2 at Rockhurst (1/4/2020)

Truman

2020-21: Started all 23 games and was named First Team All GLVC...led the conference in assists with almost six per game, 134 total, set a new career hgh with 12 against UIndy on 2/4...also set a single game high with six steals at William Jewell on 2/20 (one off the Truman single game record)...averaged a career high 12 points per game...shot .487 from the field for the year and .435 from three point range...finished the year with 27 steals...named Academic All GLVC

2019-20: Started all 31 games…led team with 34.5 minutes played per contest—good for sixth in the conference…fifth on the team with a scoring average of 9.8 points per game, with a season high 18 against Rockhurst in the GLVC Quarterfinals (3/6) and at Bellarmine (2/13); which included the game winning 30-foot three pointer…made 42 three pointers on the season, third most on the team, with a season high four against Cedarville (11/9) and at McKendree (1/25)…was third in the GLVC in assists with 4.1 per game (128 total) and had a career high nine at Maryville (2/27)…also set career highs with seven rebounds against NW Missouri State (12/20) and in blocks with two at Rockhurst (1/4)…shot 42-52 from the free throw line, one of four Bulldogs to shoot over 80% from the stripe…second on the team in steals with 34, averaging 1.1 per game…had the top assist to turnover ratio in the GLVC at 3.1/1

2018-19: Scored a career high 29 points against William Jewell on 12/1 on 12-20 shooting…passed the 20 point threshold one other time—against Sioux Falls on 11/24…opened the season with double digit points in the first eight games…made 103 shots, and 29 threes on his way to averaging 9.2 points per game, up from 7.0 a season ago (3.41 assists per game was tenth overall in the GLVC)…shot .412 from the field and .330 from three point range…grabbed 80 total boards (2.8 per game), up from 60 in 2017-18…dished out 99 assists and nabbed 31 steals…averaged 30.3 minutes per game, up from 23.7 a season ago…named Academic All-GLVC

2017-18: Appeared in 29 of the team's 31 games with 22 starts and took over at point guard for one of the program's greats in Dwight Sistrunk Jr. ... averaged seven points per game with a total of 75 assists, which was good for third on the team behind Brodric Thomas' 110 and Jake Velky's 76 ... scored at least 10 points in a game eight times including a personal-best 21 on Feb. 22 vs. William Jewell inside Pershing Arena ... reached that feat just twice in his first 18 games before starting to settle in and doing so in six of the final 11 games ... also in that final 11-game stretch, Scott went for five or more assists four times including seven vs. both Wisconsin-Parkside on Feb. 15 and Drury on March 3 in the GLVC Tournament ... in his first 18 games, Scott tallied that many assists just once and that was against Missouri S&T on Jan. 4 ... named Academic All-GLVC.

2016-17: Redshirted ... named Academic All-GLVC.

High School

Earned first-team all-conference and third-team all-state accolades as a junior in 2015 under head coach BJ Windhorst ... also garnered second-team all-conference honors ... helped team to win a state title ... named Elite All-State, 4A Player of the Year and Elite All-CIML ... a two-sport athlete, Scott was a member of the class 4A all-tournament team on the hardwood in 2014 and picked up all-district honors in both 2014 and 2015 on the football field as well ... was a three-year starter and letterwinner for the basketball program ... averaged 17.1 points per game with a total of 106 assists and 43 steals ... was also both second-team and honorable mention all-conference on the football field ... member of the National Honor Society for his work in the classroom.

Personal

Son of Marybeth and Roger Scott ... is majoring in Exercise Science.
